shared.network

Interface SharedProxyClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProxyClient

    public interface SharedProxyClient
extends java.rmi.Remote

    This interface will be the client-side relay for receiving and making method calls from and to the server. Methods marked as Local are called by the server's proxy, while methods marked as Remote are called from the client towards the server.


    This interface extends Remote, to allow sending over RMI the references of implementations of this interface; thus, every method declared in it should also throw a RemoteException

    See Also:
    Remote, SharedProxyServer, ProxyClient, ProxyServer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void aPrioriWin()
      Local
      If, according to the server, all other players have left, it calls this function on the client, ending the match with your victory
      java.lang.Boolean chooseWindow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> windows, java.util.ArrayList<Cell[][]> matrices)
      Local
      After the players have been collected in a waiting room before the match begins, the server sends each player four windows through this method; also, a matrix of Cell representing each window is sent, to allow procedural printing of them
      java.lang.Boolean chooseWindowBack(java.lang.Integer window)
      Remote
      A client which has chosen the window through the view should call this method to tell the server about his choice
      void enable()
      Local
      Before each turn starts, the server calls this method on the client which should begin playing
      void endTurn()
      Remote
      Whenever a players ends its turn through an interaction with the view, this method should be called by its client

      Remote
      Whenever a player quits the waiting room through an interaction with the view, this method should be called by its client
      void exitGame2()
      Remote
      Whenever a player quits the match through an interaction with the view, this method should be called by its client
      void onTimeStatus(java.lang.String s1, java.lang.String s2)
      Local
      Whenever the connection status of a player changes, this method is called by the server on the other active players, in the same match; only one of the arguments will be passed at a time.
      java.lang.Boolean ping()
      Local
      The server calls this method before calling each of the other local ones, to check the client's availability; this method always returns true
      java.lang.Boolean placeDice(java.lang.Integer index, Position p)
      Remote
      Whenever a player wants to pick a dice from the pool and place it in his window, this method should be called by its client.
      void printScore(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicks, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> scores, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> winner)
      Local
      When a match has ended, the server calls this method on all players who played that match, providing the names, score and winner flag for each player, as an ArrayList
      void shut()
      Local
      Before each turn starts, the server calls this method on the clients which should not move during the next turn
      java.lang.String startGame(java.lang.String nick)
      Remote
      First method that SharedProxyClient should call towards the server: it will register the client using its nickname and other parameters based on the Connection used
      java.lang.Boolean startGameViewForced()
      Local
      If a player in the waiting room has not yet chosen its window and the timer for the room is up, server chooses automatically a window for that player and then calls this method on it

      Remote

      Remote
      Whenever a player wants to use one of the tool cards, it must call this method, providing the correct parameters for that tool card.

    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        java.lang.String startGame(java.lang.String nick)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        First method that SharedProxyClient should call towards the server: it will register the client using its nickname and other parameters based on the Connection used
        Parameters:
        nick - text representing player's name; it's safe to obtain it from user's input
        Returns:
        connection result message, could either be the handshake or a network issue message
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.startGame(String)

      • updateView

        void updateView(GameManagerT gameManager)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        Server calls this method on every player's client, on every turn, to send the match status as a GameManagerT. The entire statistics of the player are inside the method's gameManager parameter, and should be used to update the view
        Parameters:
        gameManager - shared element between client and server which contains all match data, updated before the last turn's start
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.updateView(GameManagerT)

      • chooseWindow

        java.lang.Boolean chooseWindow(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> windows,
                               java.util.ArrayList<Cell[][]> matrices)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        After the players have been collected in a waiting room before the match begins, the server sends each player four windows through this method; also, a matrix of Cell representing each window is sent, to allow procedural printing of them
        Parameters:
        windows - numbers of the four windows received (between 1 and 24)
        matrices - matrices of Cell representing each window layout
        Returns:
        always returns true when the method call reaches the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.chooseWindow(ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • ping

        java.lang.Boolean ping()
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        The server calls this method before calling each of the other local ones, to check the client's availability; this method always returns true
        Returns:
        always returns true when the method call reaches the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.ping()

        Throws:

      • shut

        void shut()
   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw

        ProxyClient.shut()

      • printScore

        void printScore(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nicks,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> scores,
                java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> winner)
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        When a match has ended, the server calls this method on all players who played that match, providing the names, score and winner flag for each player, as an ArrayList
        Parameters:
        nicks - list of player nicknames, alphabetically ordered (from 1 to 4 players can have played a match)
        scores - list of player scores, ordered with respect to nicknames
        winner - list of boolean flags, ordered with respect to nicknames (multiple players may have the winner flag set, if they have the same final score)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.printScore(ArrayList, ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • chooseWindowBack

        java.lang.Boolean chooseWindowBack(java.lang.Integer window)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        A client which has chosen the window through the view should call this method to tell the server about his choice
        Parameters:
        window - an Integer representing the chosen window; this must be contained in chooseWindow(ArrayList, ArrayList) first parameter, which holds the list of available window numbers
        Returns:
        a Boolean value representing the success of the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.chooseWindowBack(Integer)

      • startGameViewForced

        java.lang.Boolean startGameViewForced()
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        If a player in the waiting room has not yet chosen its window and the timer for the room is up, server chooses automatically a window for that player and then calls this method on it
        Returns:
        always returns true when the method call reaches the client
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.startGameViewForced()

      • placeDice

        java.lang.Boolean placeDice(java.lang.Integer index,
                            Position p)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        Whenever a player wants to pick a dice from the pool and place it in his window, this method should be called by its client. Dices in the pool are addressed by an index between 1 and 9, and the position on the window is a Position
        Parameters:
        index - index of the dice in the pool
        p - position of the destination position for thee selected dice on player's window
        Returns:
        a Boolean value representing the success of the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.placeDice(Integer, Position)

      • useToolC

        java.lang.Boolean useToolC(java.lang.Integer i1,
                           Position p1,
                           Position p2,
                           Position p3,
                           Position p4,
                           PositionR pr,
                           java.lang.Integer i2,
                           java.lang.Integer i3)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Remote
        Whenever a player wants to use one of the tool cards, it must call this method, providing the correct parameters for that tool card. If one or more parameters are not needed by the selected tool card, you just need to set them to null; however, this method accepts every possible parameter that a tool card could need
        Parameters:
        i1 - index of the selected tool card among the ones available from the GameManagerT that the server sent (an Integer between 1 and 12)
        p1 - first starting Position of a dice on the window
        p2 - first ending Position on the window
        p3 - second starting Position of a dice on the window
        p4 - second first ending Position on the window
        pr - dice PositionR in the round track
        i2 - dice index from the pool
        i3 - value to increment or decrement a dice
        Returns:
        a Boolean value representing the success of the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.useToolC(Integer, Position, Position, Position, Position, PositionR, Integer, Integer)

              throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        Throws:

      • onTimeStatus

        void onTimeStatus(java.lang.String s1,
                  java.lang.String s2)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Local
        Whenever the connection status of a player changes, this method is called by the server on the other active players, in the same match; only one of the arguments will be passed at a time.
        Note that this method will be only called only on the GUI's view, as not to interfere with the CLI in the middle of a turn: in fact, the connection status of all players can be observed through the GameManagerT instance sent by updateView(GameManagerT), but this happens only at the end of each turn
        Parameters:
        s1 - will contain the nick name of the player who reconnected (in this case s2 will be null)
        s2 - will contain the nick name of the player who disconnected (in this case s1 will be null)
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - see SharedProxyClient for more about this throw
        See Also:
        ProxyClient.onTimeStatus(String, String)
